thread.title: Dolphins the play in Dan Campbell’s debut
thread.title_full: Dolphins the play in Dan Campbell’s debut | New York Post

author: The Wildcat
title: Dolphins the play in Dan Campbell’s debut
text:
Including the 1997-2014 seasons in The Post, Cat’s record in print stands at 523-440 (54 percent) against the spread. 
Saturday Southern Cal (+6½) over NOTRE DAME: It’s always a kick to justify involvement in a renewal of the high-profile Oldest Sustained Intersectional Rivalry. You’re all aware of ex-HC Steve Sarkisian’s decline, fall and ultimate dismissal off SC’s loss to Washington, but talent base at Troy remains substantial. Probably the best thing for this squad under the circumstances is to refocus on a big-time foe, far away from Los Angeles. Here you go! It can be argued that the best program Dame’s beaten thus far this season is . . . Navy! Embrace the Trojans’ raw talent under the lights, for one unit.
Sunday Dolphins (+1¹/₂) over TITANS: If Sea Mammal interim HC Dan Campbell can light a fire under his troops (especially slapping them out of their bad habit of sleepy opening quarters) … even short-term … this should work, against Ken Whisenhunt’s frustrated squad that’s had a terrible time trying to convert endgame advantages into Ws. The return of multiple walking wounded helps. Frolic with the Flippers, for one unit.
Last week: 1-1. Northwestern (Loss), Browns (Win)
Season: 10-3
Follow the weekly progress of all of The Wildcat’s monitored NFL selections at www.thesportsmonitor.com/15nfl.html
